image.altText: Chinese flags fly high outside the Australian Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: The concert was set to take place in the Great Hall of Parliament House and celebrate Japan's defeat in World War II, but it was blocked by Australian officials, sparking a diplomatic blame game.

title.children: 'Untenable' Chinese embassy concert in Parliament House stopped by officials

image.altText: A group of people standing for a photo

props.synopsis: Former Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews posed for a class photo alongside Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping in China. The question on everyone's mind is why?

title.children: Why would Daniel Andrews taint his legacy by posing alongside dictators?

image.altText: derailed streetcar in lisbon portugal

props.synopsis: At least 15 people die as Lisbon's popular Gloria funicular railway car derails and crashes.

title.children: At least 15 people killed, many injured after Lisbon's famous funicular crashes

image.altText: A golden egg in a nest symbolising superannuation.

props.synopsis: Thousands of investors who were exposed to heavy losses by investing their retirement savings into the First Guardian and Shield managed investment schemes have been told they may be able to get "remediation" from the superannuation trustees that ran platforms that housed their investments.

title.children: Thousands caught in First Guardian, Shield collapse told 'remediation' may be possible

image.altText: A hand-written letter by a young student about bullying, sitting on a table.

props.synopsis: As federal and state governments devise a plan to address school bullying, a child in Tasmania escapes a distressing case of body-shaming, playground exclusion and cyber bullying.

title.children: Woman seeking school's help for bullied daughter told 'their hands are tied'

image.altText: A close shot of Ley speaking.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader says the government's deal to release 20,000 home care packages yesterday was a "defeat". Follow live.

title.children: Sussan Ley says Labor's release of 20,000 home care packages a 'defeat'

image.altText: A sign with the ad campaign tagline and a picture of sydney sweeney

props.synopsis: The ASX is following global markets with strong gains, while American Eagle shares surge in after-hours US trade amid the success of a controversial ad campaign featuring Sydney Sweeney. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX gains strongly, American Eagle shares surge on earnings update

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX opens solidly higher on Wall St, European gains
Sydney Sweeney sells for American Eagle
Choice warns of potentially unsafe cots for sale

image.altText: A couple stand in an apartment looking into camera with a serious expression. One is holding a cat.

props.synopsis: A year after they moved into an "affordable" apartment in a new public-private housing development in inner Melbourne, Alix and Tiarn were told their rent would increase by 17 per cent. They say their experience highlights flaws in the model the Victorian government is using to redevelop its aging public housing towers.

title.children: 'Affordable' housing tenants face $55 per week rent increase

image.altText: A group of men wearing black.

props.synopsis: A man will face court today charged with offences related to the attack on Camp Sovereignty over the weekend. Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell is being held in custody over the incident.

title.children: More arrests over Camp Sovereignty attack that left multiple people injured

image.altText: Police cars and an ambulance out the front of a pub, which says 'Bar Broadway' at night.

props.synopsis: The man, 18, is accused of grabbing an officer by the face and verbally abusing police after they attempted to break up a brawl on Sunday.

title.children: Third person charged over brawl after anti-immigration rally

image.altText: A blue board shows a photo of Epstein and Maxwell hugging, beside a series of dot-pointed text. A hand points to the photo..

props.synopsis: Interest in the 20-year-old case has exploded in recent months even as US President Donald Trump urged the public to move on from what he deems a "pretty boring" saga.

title.children: Amid fresh revelations, here are the key events in the Epstein saga

image.altText: New houses and land for sale at a housing development

props.synopsis: Housing affordability remains around record lows, despite recent rate cuts, but it is not stopping an above-average number of first-time buyers from entering the market, according to a new report.

title.children: Adelaide overtakes Sydney as the toughest market for first home buyers

image.altText: Two photos one of a slim woman standing in a pharmacy, and another of the same women looking larger.

props.synopsis: Mary Baker became increasingly angry when she saw her image manipulated and doctored in an AI-generated weight-loss endorsement on social media.

title.children: Pharmacist shocked to see her AI-manipulated photo in weight loss ads

image.altText: Tony Burke at press conference

props.synopsis: The sight of neo-Nazis trying to whip up community anger and recruit new followers drove home to all how criticism of Australia's migration program can lead to and even legitimise hate speech, racism, and violence.

title.children: What's the cost of support for Australia's migration program? $408m and then some

image.altText: A man in his late 20s with dark brown hair, smiling, sitting in farming equipment

props.synopsis: When Luke Bateman was at the peak of his NRL career in 2019, his life outwardly exemplified the dream of many young Australian men, but the reality was much grimmer.

title.children: 'I couldn't buy groceries': Luke Bateman admits 'debilitating' gambling addiction

image.altText: A bunch of signs on a beach saying "Our ocean is not a dump".

props.synopsis: Ex-HMAS Adelaide was sunk in 2011, 1.8 kilometres off the shoreline of Avoca Beach — a well-known surf break less than 2 hours north of Sydney.

title.children: A military warship sunken for diving is now a 'complex tangle of broken aluminium'

image.altText: Alex de Mianur playing a backhand tennis shot, with one hand, outstretched

props.synopsis: It is heartbreak for Alex de Minaur once again at the US Open, as the Australian fails to break through to the semifinals at a major for the first time in his career.

title.children: De Minaur's QF hoodoo strikes again as Aussie bows out at US Open

image.altText: A picture of a boxing referee raising the hand of a South Korean boxer as his American opponent looks stunned.

props.synopsis: Roy Jones Jr reveals that the South Korean fighter who won the Olympic gold medal over him in a controversial final in Seoul has given him the medal.

title.children: Boxing great receives Olympic gold — from man who controversially beat him

image.altText: Jasveen Sangha wearing a GUCCI t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Sangha is the last of the five suspects charged in the case to plead guilty rather than stand trial.

title.children: 'Ketamine Queen' pleads guilty in Matthew Perry's drug death

image.altText: A young woman in a hospital gown sitting on a bed with her face in her hands.

props.synopsis: A survey of Australian women with a condition called hyperemesis gravidarum found more than half considered terminating their pregnancy, and 90 per cent considered having no more children.

title.children: Rebekah had never heard of hyperemesis before it landed her in hospital

image.altText: Close-up photo of clasped hands on lap.

props.synopsis: The sexual assault victimisation rate is now the highest it has been since the ABS began releasing data in 1993.

title.children: Recorded sexual assaults surpass 40,000 nationwide

image.altText: A dead fish on a river bank

props.synopsis: The Anglesea River — a tourism drawcard on the Surf Coast and place of pride for locals — has seen repeat fish kills in recent years, with both residents and experts at a loss as to restore the river's health.

title.children: The neon green river killing fish on Victoria's surf coast

image.altText: a bag labelled MSM with a white powder inside

props.synopsis: The Queensland government had threatened to shut down the service, saying it would either "legislate or regulate" to stop drug checking.

title.children: Drug checking service won't reopen as planned after government threats

image.altText: Nick Daicos of the Magpies tries to get through Jordan Dawson and Wayne Milera of the Crows

props.synopsis: With a cohesive and suffocating defence, the Adelaide Crows have the tools to put the ghosts of 2017 behind them and reach the top of the AFL mountain.

title.children: Adelaide's AFL finals drought is over, and defence has them set for success

image.altText: A car with a bullet-ridden windshield sits with tape around it as people look at it in a carpark

props.synopsis: The terror group said it was behind a bomb that went off in Balochistan province, killing 15 people.

title.children: Islamic State claims responsibility for deadly bombing in Pakistan

image.altText: A boy with only one hand holds up a rose as he wears a sling around his neck. Other children aroung him also hold roses

props.synopsis: A UN committee says at least 21,000 children in Gaza have been left with disabilities since the war between Israel and Hamas began on October 7, 2023.

title.children: UN says Gaza war has left at least 21,000 children with disabilities

image.altText: A man and woman stand side-by-side looking at the camera standing in front of a grey stone building

props.synopsis: Pari Island residents have flown to Europe to state their case in Switzerland, as their Indonesian homes are ravaged by the impacts of climate change.

title.children: Tiny island takes on cement giant in 'David vs Goliath' climate change battle

image.altText: Guy McKenna and Jaeger O'Meara

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast Suns were smashed from pillar to post in their early years. Their coach from that time, Eagles great Guy McKenna, reflects on the club's long road to the finals.

title.children: Inaugural Suns coach McKenna reflects on 15-year road to first final

image.altText: A bidder throws up a H sign at an auction

props.synopsis: Some of Victoria's most exclusive heritage number plates have new owners after an auction saw buyers spend millions of dollars.

title.children: Victorian number plate sells for $650k as buyers spend big at auction

image.altText: a seal underwater looks at the camera

props.synopsis: A colony of seals on the New South Wales Far South Coast has been fitted with tracking devices as researchers work to find out more about them and the environment.

title.children: 'Wet dogs' enlisted to help scientists shed light on climate change

image.altText: Front entrance of a childcare centre featuring a sign attached to a fence reading "welcome".

props.synopsis: A childcare operator who tried to force a pregnant employee to resign is among those named and shamed by the federal government in a recent crackdown on national quality standards.

title.children: Perth childcare centres failing basic quality checks named

image.altText: Wind farm towers are shown in paddocks in Tasmania

props.synopsis: A 47-turbine wind farm has been approved for Tasmania's central highlands, with the project resulting in a new wind farm noise policy for Tasmania — which opponents say could cast doubt over the entire project.

title.children: Wind farm approved in Tasmania with 'narrow margin' for noise

image.altText: A white and purple orchid.

props.synopsis: The fight to save the veined doubletail orchid had a breakthrough in the Black Summer bushfires and now elders are leading a series of cultural burns to regenerate the endangered flower.

title.children: After a fire tore through the bush, 4,000 rare orchids popped up in its wake
